names.english: soothe the heart and invigorate the blood decoction
names.commonEnglish: Soothe the Heart and Invigorate the Blood Decoction

actions: Tonifies Qi and Blood, promotes the discharge of pus, generates flesh, expels toxins and relieves numbness and pain.
With Dang Shen, for Qi Deficiency with general debility, anorexia, fatigue, tired extremities and spontaneous sweating.
Tonifies the Middle Jiao, augments Qi and nourishes the Blood.
With Huang Qi, for Lung and Spleen Qi Deficiency with fatigue, shortness of breath, diarrhea and anorexia.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, moistens the Intestines, unblocks the bowels, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and alleviates pain.
With Huang Qi, for Qi and Blood Deficiency.
Invigorates the Blood and dispels Blood Stasis.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, opens the channels and alleviates pain.

syndromes: Blood Stasis due to Blood deficiency

symptoms: Chest pain radiating to the upper back
Pain is often worse with taxation
Pain along the Liver or Gallbladder channel
manifestations.tongue: Pale or Dark purplish or Static macules or Spots
manifestations.pulse: Thready and weak or Wiry and choppy
